text: [Music]
I'm friends I am Niharika and welcome
back to a new lesson so do you often get
confused between the words I me my mine
and myself really you do well I'm just
kidding
most of us definitely get confused with
these words so here in this lesson today
we are gonna look at the difference
between these words and when to use the
right one so let's have a look so we're
gonna start with I and me
so let's first understand when do we use
I now I is used as a subject okay but
you are the person who is performing the
action so when you are referring to
yourself as a subject that is when you
are supposed to use the word I so let's
have a look at a sentence here
I gave John the book so here I I am the
person who is performing the action okay
so I am the one who's giving the book to
John so I is the subject and that's
exactly the reason why I have used I now
let's understand when do we use me now
me is an object okay so when you are at
the receiving end okay when you are the
receiving end of an action that has been
you use the word me okay
now let's have a look at a sentence here
John gave me the book so here John is
the subject whereas me is the object
okay so John gave me the book I am at
the receiving end of the action and
that's when we use the word me now most
of the people get confused when there
are multiple subjects or
objects and that's when they do not
understand that whether we should use I
or me so we are gonna have a look at
some sentences here
that would explain us in a bedroom
manner John and I saw Jane at the party
okay so here John is a subject and I is
also the subject okay because we are the
people who saw Jane at the party so it's
John and I saw Jane at the party okay
so Jean here would be the object and
always remember you use the other
person's name first and then refer to
yourself okay so for example if there
are three people okay so it's gonna be
Jim John and I saw Jane at the party
okay so you always use the other
people's names first and then you use I
okay now let's have a look at another
sentence here the teacher called Sarah
and me now you would wonder that why
have I used me here so let's understand
that so here the teacher is the subject
okay the reason because she is
performing the action okay she is
calling Sarah and me so here Sarah and
me are the objects okay so always
remember you use I when it's a subject
okay you are the person who's doing the
action whereas you use me when someone
else is performing in action okay so
that's the way you would use the words I
and me now let's have a look how would
you use my and mine now let's have a
look at my and mine now always remember
that my is used before a noun
whereas mine is used at the end of the
sentence now to explain this better
let's have a look at a sentence here
John is my friend now here my is used
before a noun friend and if you look at
this intense here John is a friend of
mine so here the word mine is used at
the end of that sentence
now let's have a look at another
sentence here John's car is white and
mine is black now this looks a little
different to you right so let's
understand this so here we have said
John's car is white and mine is black so
it's obvious that we are referring to
the car okay so mine is black so this
means my car is black so here the word
mine is replacing my and the noun
car okay so always remember that mine is
not supposed to be used with the noun
okay so that's exactly the reason why it
says mine is black okay if I had to say
mine then I would say that my car is
black because I'm using it before ax now
right now most of these guys always tell
their girlfriends that you're mine okay
now they don't say you're mine right now
if you have to say okay you're my
girlfriend okay so here you're using my
before a noun girlfriend but if you not
to use the word mine and a noun then you
would say you're mine okay so that's the
basic difference between my and mine and
now let's have a look at myself' so when
we use the word myself now the word
myself is a pronoun which is used when
you are performing an action on yourself
so there's nobody else who's doing
something to you okay so you are
performing an action on yourself
all right so let's have a look at some
sentences here I cut myself with a knife
so probably you were chopping some
vegetables and you cut yourself by
mistake okay so it was your mistake so
this action was performed on you okay so
nobody else cut to you it was you who
did it
so that's exactly the reason why we are
using the pronoun myself so I cut myself
with a knife now let's see another one
here I baked a cake myself now there's
another way to use the word myself is
when you have to emphasize on an action
that you have done okay so here I baked
a cake just let's hide the word myself I
bake the cake is also a correct sentence
but if you have to really emphasize on
what you just did
then you can you use the word myself so
I baked a cake myself okay I saw him
doing that myself okay so you are
emphasizing on your action and that's
exactly the reason why you're using the
pronoun myself now there's another
expression by myself
now what does that mean now when people
use I did this by myself so this means
that the person was all alone okay
so him he or she was alone performing
that action so for example I went for a
movie by myself so there was nobody to
accompany me for a movie so I went and
watched the movie by myself so this
means I was all alone watching the movie
so this is how you would use the words I
mean I
mine and myself now if you have learnt
